EmploymentHistory.title: Metallurgist
EmploymentHistory.description:
An Australian mining company, listed on the Australian Securities Exchange (ASX). It operates the site that produces 68,000 tonnes of contained copper in concentrate per year through processing 1.5 Mt of massive sulphide ore. The site has been operating since 2012 and has generated over $1 billion in revenue.

Key Responsibilities
- Providing daily technical support to processing team members so they are able to meet their production targets
- Reviewing, managing, and improving metallurgical performance to meet long-term targets
- Metallurgical accounting and reporting
- Recording, and reporting on, overall equipment effectiveness
- Ensuring expenditure on production consumables, reagents and laboratory operations is in line with the operating cost budget
- Liaising with maintenance and processing teams to ensure optimum performance of the plant.
- Implementing and maintaining short-term and medium-term production planning to provide accurate, detailed forecasts
- Optimising operation of processing equipment (e.g. jaw crusher, SAG and Ball mills, flotation cells, thickeners, froth buster and Larox pressure filter)
- Participating as a member of the business’ Emergency Response Team (2013)

EmploymentHistory.title: Pilot Plant Coordinator
EmploymentHistory.description:
Company operates five mines located at the Iron Quadrangle and produces 4 Mt per year of iron ore concentrate. It also runs a Technological Development Department which incorporates chemical and metallurgical laboratories, a pilot plant facility, and an engineering team to progress greenfield project studies.

- Managing a crew of five Process Technicians and two Assistants
- Planning, monitoring, and executing pilot plant test works for greenfield iron ore projects, with a focus on grinding, flotation, dense medium separation and dewatering processes
- Performing metallurgical mass balancing for the tested circuit
- Interpreting pilot plant results and performing processing simulations to support design criteria for major projects
- Consolidating the processing route tested

EmploymentHistory.title: Plant Metallurgist
EmploymentHistory.description:
Company was an Australian-based company that operated a sulphide nickel mine in Brazil ( Mine Site). A total of 6.3 Mt of ore is processed annually through its flotation processing plant to produce around 115 kt of nickel concentrate at 13% Ni. The deposit is supported by an open pit mine with an anticipated life of 20 years.

Key Responsibilities
- Developing the metallurgical accounting system
- Defining daily processing targets, including optimisation of flotation and grinding processes
Providing engineering support to the operational team during the commissioning and start up of the sulphide nickel plant
- Studying, planning, and monitoring the test works for the de-watering optimisation process
- Providing daily technical support to processing team members, so they are able to meet their production targets
- Developing training packages, and delivering onsite training for all Operators throughout the mine
- Optimising operation of processing equipment (e.g. SAG and Ball mills, tank cells, and thickeners, online assays analysers, and Larox pressure filter)

EmploymentHistory.title: Minerals Processing Engineer
EmploymentHistory.description:
An engineering company with extensive experience in multidisciplinary industrial projects and an emphasis on the mineral sector (e.g. concentration plants, pelletizing plants, the steel industry, and non-ferrous metallurgy). It provides support to all stages of projects: design (processing route definition, conceptual and feasibility studies, detailed engineering), construction (engineering, procurement and management), commissioning, and operations (technical support and plant optimisations).

Developing technical specifications for designed equipment
- Planning and managing laboratory and pilot plant scale test works to consolidate engineering design criteria
- Performing cost optimisation studies for processing routes
- Dimensioning of processing equipment to support greenfield and brownfield mineral processing plants projects
